answers.answer: I got really bad headaches in the beginning of this pregnancy and my Dr thought they were tension headaches and had me focus on keeping my jaw relaxed. It seemed to help some. Also making sure I was extra hydrated helped.

Try drinking some caffeine and see if it helps. I ended up on reglan for migraines when I was in my first trimester. Also try pinching between your thumb.and poo.ter finger...see if the pressure pointhelps it.
Thanks guys... I would love to have some caffeine but im on a caffeine free diet. My body isnt really that tense either. Idk but i hate waking up to these headaches.

Im 12 wks and getting really bad headaches too. They are so bad by the time i go to sleep, i just cant take it... Im waiting for my next apt to ask the dr. About a week.. Im sure hes guna say tjeres nothing he can do so whats the point i guess we just have to tough it out
I'm the same way too. Now I'm 16weeks it's getting worse. I just go to sleep. My doctor has been eyeing my bp since it might be preeclampsia but so far it's ok.

I had migraines before I got pregnant but when I had a 5 day long one and Tylenol did nothing they gave me some stronger stuff. I don't have to take it much only if its unbearable. Plus they normally get way less frequent at about 20wks for me. Talk to your dr if they start interfering with your daily life. Also pure peppermint oil on your temple or neck helps. A hot shower. Heating pad on back of neck or forehead helps. The best one is magnesium. Magnesium helps relax the brain and you need more magnesium while pregnant so it could just be your not getting enough. I normally take mine before bed and I don't wake up with a headache nearly as much. Goodluck. Headaches are evil.
I will be 17 weeks tomorrow and I'm going through the same thing. Naps help and putting a ice pack on the back of your neck helps too. Good luck :)
Can it be your dehydrated? I had them and realized that I needed lots of water.
Look at your diet and then look at foods that cause migraines I changed my diet and now I'm head ache free !!!

I read that you are on a diet? What kind of diet? You should not be dieting while pregnant but eating healthy balanced meals. If you are dieting could be that you are not eating enough and your sugar can be low. Very s,all amounts of caffeine while pregnant is okay! Best of luck!

question: Idk what to do. I have been getting really bad headaches that won't go away. I've been taking Tylenol since that the only thing i can take.... Im 14 weeks & 3 days. These headaches are making me miserable. What can i do??
title: I cant take it much longer
